alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 10:49PM PST until February 23 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING HAS BEEN REPLACED BY A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY, WHICH IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow at times. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph, especially near the Columbia Gorge. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as zero. * WHERE...Greater Vancouver Area. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 AM PST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Snow covered roads will linger into the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
